file_content.text: It's impressive, you know. People from all over the galaxy want to stand behind you.
We'll need every last one of them and more to make this work.
It's not enough.
This is how it was always going to be.
It's my destiny.
That can't be what you were out here contemplating.
What's really on your mind?
It is, in a way. I was thinking how so many Scions followed Heskal.
He would have them die as he did because their deaths were foreseen. Their visions provide great insight, but they're not infallible.
Reminds me of the Heralds of Zildrog.
There's another leader who paid for his certainty.
Say what you will about Valkorion, but he at least considered the viewpoints of others. He listened to me. Most of the time.
He didn't--he would never have done what--what Arcann....
What is it?
Arcann had a twin. Thexan. They were inseparable until his death. Vaylin told me, during our fight... Arcann murdered Thexan.
His own brother. Maybe if I had raised him....
Your fight with Vaylin--what happened?
What she had to say, it struck me down to my core. Paralyzed me. She slipped away.
Now more than ever, I realize my children must be stopped and that I have to make peace with the choices I've made.
Whatever you've done to get here, I hope you can do the same.
She raises a good question: How do you look back on your path to this moment?
You mean that whirlwind of insanity?
It's a blur.
I made the decisions I felt were right. That's about all any of us can ever do.
I have no regrets.
You're in my head. Why don't you take a look for yourself?
Not going to read my thoughts?
And what good would that do our alliance?
You may not see an alliance, but our destinies are now intertwined. Take advantage of that fact and there is much you will be capable of.
I see you defeating Arcann, even if there are those on this world who disagree.
What does that mean? Who disagrees?
You will learn soon enough....
He's out there somewhere. Our own father, plotting against us.
He's not the only one. After I told Mother that you killed Thexan, she probably wants your head.
But it's not a problem. You have the throne, the fleet, this whole empire.... You're as safe from her as can be.
I wish Thexan could be here now. He'd see I was right to challenge Father.
Imagine it: the three of us ruling this empire as it was meant to be ruled.
I'd like it if Thexan were here, too. But that's no longer possible.
If you really want us to feel more like a family again, we can make that happen.
Thexen wasn't our only sibling....
Yes. That's what Heskal believed, too. Look at how the Scions followed him.
I was worried Heskal had blinded you with his certainty like he did with the Scions.
A life without regret is a life well-lived... though I suppose it remains to be seen whether you will ultimately succeed.
Personally, I see you defeating Arcann. Others on this world disagree.
Make light of it if you wish, but you've accomplished much and come far since your reawakening.
We are of one purpose, but your mind is your own. Use it well and you will succeed.
Doesn't matter. Father has a new favorite. He wants the Outlander to take all of this from you.
I'll die before I let that happen to us.
Of course you will.
I told you before that Arcann had a brother. Thexan. They were inseparable until his death. Vaylin told me, during our fight... Arcann murdered Thexan.
